member.name: T:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream
member.summary:
This filter stream is used to decompress a LZW format stream. Specifically, a stream that uses the LZC compression method. This file format is usually associated with the .Z file extension.
See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compress See http://wiki.wxwidgets.org/Development:_Z_File_Format
The file header consists of 3 (or optionally 4) bytes. The first two bytes contain the magic marker "0x1f 0x9d", followed by a byte of flags.
Based on Java code by Ronald Tschalar, which in turn was based on the unlzw.c code in the gzip package.

member.name: F:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.MAGIC
member.summary: Magic number found at start of LZW header: 0x1f 0x9d

member.name: F:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.MAX_BITS
member.summary: Maximum number of bits per code

member.name: F:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.BIT_MASK
member.summary: Mask for 'number of compression bits'

member.name: F:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.EXTENDED_MASK
member.summary: Indicates the presence of a fourth header byte

member.name: F:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.RESERVED_MASK
member.summary: Reserved bits

member.name: F:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.BLOCK_MODE_MASK
member.summary: Block compression: if table is full and compression rate is dropping, clear the dictionary.

member.name: F:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.HDR_SIZE
member.summary: LZW file header size (in bytes)

member.name: F:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.INIT_BITS
member.summary: Initial number of bits per code

member.name: P:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.IsStreamOwner
member.summary: Get/set flag indicating ownership of underlying stream. When the flag is true Stream.Close will close the underlying stream also.

member.summary: Creates a LzwInputStream
member.param: The stream to read compressed data from (baseInputStream LZW format)

member.summary: See

member.name: M:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads decompressed data into the provided buffer byte array
member.param: The array to read and decompress data into
The offset indicating where the data should be placed
The number of bytes to decompress
member.returns: The number of bytes read. Zero signals the end of stream

member.name: M:Accord.IO.Compression.LzwInputStream.ResetBuf(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the unread data in the buffer to the beginning and resets the pointers.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading

member.summary: Gets a value of false indicating seeking is not supported for this stream.

member.summary: Gets a value of false indicating that this stream is not writeable.

member.exception: Attempting to set the position

member.summary: Flushes the baseInputStream

member.name: T:Accord.IO.IdxReader
member.summary: Reader for IDX files (such as MNIST's digit database).

member.name: P:Accord.IO.IdxReader.Magic
member.summary: MNIST's magic number. See remarks for more details

remarks.para: The magic number is an integer (MSB first). The first 2 bytes are always 0. The third byte codes the type of the data. The 4-th byte codes the number of dimensions of the vector/matrix: 1 for vectors, 2 for matrices.

member.name: T:Accord.IO.ExcelReader
member.summary: Excel file reader using Microsoft Jet Database Engine.

remarks.para: This class requires the Microsoft Access Database Engine to work. The download is available from Microsoft under the name "Microsoft Access Database Engine 2010 Redistributable", available in both 32-bit (x86) and 64-bit (x64) versions.

By default, the redistributable package will only install if it is the same as the current version of Microsoft Office installed in the machine (i.e. ACE 32-bit can not be installed with 64-bit office and vice-versa). To overcome this limitation and install both versions of the ACE drivers, specify /passive as a command line argument when installing the packages.

member.name: M:Accord.IO.ExcelReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new spreadsheet reader.
member.param: The stream containing the spreadsheet file.
True if the file should be treated as .xlsx file, false otherwise. Default is true.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.Resources.ExceptionMessage.NotEnoughSpaceInArray
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of fields in the record is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array..

member.name: P:Accord.IO.Resources.ExceptionMessage.RecordIndexLessThanZero

member.name: M:Accord.IO.SparseWriter.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Accord.IO.SparseWriter.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Accord.IO.SparseWriter.Finalize
member.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: T:Accord.IO.SparseReader
member.summary: Reader for data files containing samples in libsvm's sparse format.

example.para: The following example shows how to read all sparse samples from a file and retrieve them as a dense multidimensional vector.
Additionally, it is also possible to read each sample individually and sequentially. For this, we can use a while loop until we reach the end of the stream.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.SparseReader.BaseStream
member.summary: Returns the underlying stream.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.SparseReader.Intercept
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to include an intercept term (bias) value at the beginning of each new sample. Default is null (don't include anything).

member.name: P:Accord.IO.SparseReader.SampleDescriptions
member.summary: Gets the description associated with the last read values.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.SparseReader.Dimensions
member.summary: Obsolete. Please use instead.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.SparseReader.NumberOfInputs
member.summary: Gets the number of features present in this dataset. Please note that, when using the sparse representation, it is not strictly necessary to know this value.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The complete file path to be read.
The size of the feature vectors stored in the file.

member.name: P:Accord.IO.SparseReader.EndOfStream
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current stream position is at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:Accord.IO.SparseReader.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads one line from the feature file, returning the array of values for the sparse vector and its corresponding label.
member.returns: A tuple containing the array of values in the format "index:value" as the first item and their corresponding label as the second item.

member.name: M:Accord.IO.SparseReader.ReadSparse
member.summary: Reads a sample from the file and returns it as a sparse vector, together with its associated output value.
member.returns: A tuple containing the sparse vector as the first item and its associated output value as the second item.

member.name: T:Accord.IO.ValueTrimmingOptions
member.summary: Field trimming options.

member.name: F:Accord.IO.ValueTrimmingOptions.None
member.summary: Do not trim any fields.

member.name: F:Accord.IO.ValueTrimmingOptions.UnquotedOnly
member.summary: Only trim unquoted fields.

member.name: F:Accord.IO.ValueTrimmingOptions.QuotedOnly
member.summary: Only Trim quoted fields.

member.name: F:Accord.IO.ValueTrimmingOptions.All
member.summary: Trim all fields (quoted and unquoted).
